comment._content: Another great location in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. This fort's name is "San Felipe del Morro" But puertoricans call it just El Morro. Facing the Atlantic Ocean, and build during the Spanish Conquest, this huge building was used as the Headquarters for the Spanish Army, it was used also as a jail. The tower (Check the note) or "garita" were strategic points were the guardians kept an eye on the huge ocean, keeping the island protected at all times. Now, tourists from all over the world visit this building and admire the history trapped butween it's walls. A view of the outside of the "Morro" Please check the note!
